expressionParser

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • expressionParser.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parser class can be used to parse expressions and transform the representation form string to an expression graph. This parser works only for boolean expressions. The algorithm implies 3 main steps:
    1. Create a queue from a string. This queue contains all elements in the same order as in the string.
    2. Create a queue, by applying Shunting-Yard algorithm over the queue resulted at the previous step.
    3. Create the expression tree form the last queue.
    Each step can be reproduced alone, if needed.
    Author:
    razvan

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Parser getInstance()
        Get an instance of Parser class. If there does not exist one, then it is created and returned, otherwise return the existing instance.
        Returns:
        an instance of Parser class

      • createExprGraph

        public ExprNode createExprGraph(java.lang.String expression)
        Create an expression tree directly from a string. It uses all the 3 steps:
        1. Create a queue from a string. This queue contains all elements in the same order as in the string.
        2. Create a queue, by applying Shunting-Yard algorithm over the queue resulted at the previous step.
        3. Create the expression tree form the last queue.
        If the expression is "nil" then null is returned. If the parsing fails, then it is displayed "Error while parsing..." message.
        Parameters:
        expression - given as string
        Returns:
        the expression tree, more precisely the root node.

      • createQueue

        public java.util.Queue<ExprNode> createQueue(java.lang.String str)
        Create a queue from a given string. It parses the expression and for each word, an expression node is created and put into a queue.
        Parameters:
        str - which is an expression
        Returns:
        the resulted queue

      • createShuntingYardQueue

        public java.util.Queue<ExprNode> createShuntingYardQueue(java.util.Queue<ExprNode> inQueue)
        This method is an implementation of Shunting-Yard algorithm to create a queue where no parentheses is needed, from an infix notation to a postfix notation (such as reversed polish notation).
        Parameters:
        inQueue - is a queue of expression nodes in infix notation
        Returns:
        a queue where no parentheses is needed in postfix notation
        See Also:
        Shunting-Yard algorithm on Wikipedia

      • createGraphUsingQueue

        public ExprNode createGraphUsingQueue(java.util.Queue<ExprNode> queue)
        This method creates an expression tree from a queue of expressions, in infix notation. It takes each element from queue and put each operand in a stack. If, in this time, an AND node or an OR node is found, then it its created a subtree with last two operands from the stack. The last subtree (which is the final tree) is returned.
        Parameters:
        queue - in infix notation
        Returns:
        an expression tree

      • getWords

        private java.lang.String getWords(java.lang.String str,
                                  int n,
                                  char finalChar)
        This method takes first n words from a string up to finalChar. For example, the next code:

        String string = "((le value 2.3) && (ge value 1))";
        getWords(string, 3, ')')

        will have as output the following string: "le value 2.3"
        Parameters:
        str - the initial string
        n - number of words
        finalChar - the last char (is not taken)
        Returns:
        the string containing maximum n words
